articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: India approves third moon mission, months after landing failure
articles.description: India has approved its third lunar mission months after its last one failed to successfully land on the moon, its space agency said on Wednesday, the latest effort in its ambitions to become a low-cost space power.
articles.content:
BENGALURU (Reuters) - India has approved its third lunar mission months after its last one failed to successfully land on the moon, its space agency said on Wednesday, the latest effort in its ambitions to become a low-cost space power.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: China cuts banks' reserve ratios again, frees up $115 billion to spur economy
articles.description: China's central bank said on Wednesday it was cutting the amount of cash that all banks must hold as reserves, releasing around 800 billion yuan (86.7 billion pounds) in liquidity to shore up the slowing economy.
articles.content:

articles.author: Linda Sieg
articles.title: Ghosn flight prompts talk of more curbs in Japan's strict justice system
articles.description: Carlos Ghosn's daring flight from Japan, where he was awaiting trial on charges of financial wrongdoing, has revived global criticism of the nation's "hostage justice," but in Japan is prompting talk of reversing more lenient curbs on defendants.

articles.title: Surveillance in a leafy enclave, Ghosn's Tokyo life was under strict monitoring

articles.title: Zimbabwe's Delta lager sales hit by power, fuel shortages
articles.description: Zimbabwe's Delta Corporation, the country's largest drinks maker, reported a 48% fall in half-year lager sales compared with the same period last year after output and distribution were hit by shortages of electricity and fuel.

articles.author: Syed Raza Hassan
articles.title: Pakistan inflation 12.63% in December - statistics bureau
articles.description: Pakistan’s annual inflation rate dropped marginally in December to 12.63% compared with 12.67% in November, as some commodity prices eased, the Bureau of Statistics said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
KARACHI, Pakistan (Reuters) - Pakistan’s annual inflation rate dropped marginally in December to 12.63% compared with 12.67% in November, as some commodity prices eased, the Bureau of Statistics said on Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Macau casino revenue falls in December the most in almost 4 years
articles.description: Gambling revenue in the Chinese territory of Macau fell 13.7% in December from a year earlier, marking the steepest decline in close to four years.
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Gambling revenue in the Chinese territory of Macau fell 13.7% in December from a year earlier, marking the steepest decline in close to four years.

articles.title: Samsung Electronics chip output at South Korea plant partly halted due to short blackout
